div.p: A345 Royal Park Zoological Society letter copy and minute book, p. 4, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

I have the honor to inform you, that at a Meeting of the Trustees of the Royal Park held this day, I was instructed to state in reply to your letter dated 30th August,
A letter from C. Hodgkinson was read at the Trustee's meeting of 20 September 'in which he stated, that previous to Crown grant for the Park being made out for the Trustees it would be necessary, that the Code of regulations adopted by the Trustees should be submitted to the Board of Land & Works, also that all grazing fees should be expended in that portion of the Park not specially enclosed for zoological purposes.' M was directed to submit to Hodgkinson a copy of the rules for the approval of the Board, and to state, that any changes to the rules would be submitted to the Board prior to coming into force, and that grazing fees had been expended according to the wishes of the Board (A345, pp. 121-22). that the grazing fees hitherto raised by the Trustees at the Park have nearly been expended in improvements of the fences roads & of the extensive ground and that the remaining balance as well as any other fees which may be received there, will be expended in the same manner.

I have further been instructed by the Trustees to transmit to you for the consideration of the honorable the Board of Land & Works a copy of the rules and regulations hitherto in force at the Park, and this document I have now the honor to annex. The Trustees desire me also to state, that whenever circumstances will render any alterations of these rules desirable, that these previous to their introduction will be submitted for the consideration of the Board of Land & Works.

I have further the honor to solicit on behalf of the Trustees, that the Board of Land & Works may be pleased to take into consideration the propriety of conveying the area of the Royal Park in a Crown lands Grant to the Trustees.
